text: Bottle sample at a tasting at Tom Ls place. Thanks zvsn. Dark brown with a tan head. A little lactic, chocolate and then roastiness, followed by a little bit of oatmeal in the nose, sourish, a little roasty, rather unpleasing taste. Full body, fizzy, sourish finish.
70cl bottle @ hotel room, Prague. Aroma has coffee and cocoa. Flavour has cocoa, coffee, minerals and ash. Also tobacco and some salty licorice. Good.
Bottle shared at a tasting. Thanks Rotin and Ascelja! Deep brown with a beige head. Aroma of roast, green, coffee, soy. Sweet, sourish, coffee, prunes, soy. Medium-bodied, smooth. Too old maybe.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Tom Ls place. Thanks zvsn. Black. Roast, coffee, some chocolate, a bit sourish, sweetish note, bitterish finish.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Blackish pour with a light tan head. Notes of licorice, bitter chocolate, roasty, ash and a medium bitterness.
Keg at dno pytle. Pours black, nose is roasted coffee, chocolate, toffee, taste is sweet, bitter coffee, liquorice.

Bottle, 750 ml from 100piv. Shared with JFK10000 and Josip. Pours black with medium tan head. Light roastiness, malty, chocolate, some caramel. Smooth, low carbonation. Bitter finish. Light to medium bodied.

Bottle 750ml. w. swing top. [ As Albrecht 17° Morion Irish Stout ].ABV: 6.5%. Clear dark black brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, burnt, chocolate, dark malt. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, sweet malt, sugary, dark malt, roasted, chocolate, wood, bread, light coffee. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20161018]
 7-4-7-3-15
bottle from a little bottle shop on Pohořelec, Hradčany in Prague. Deep black with an off-white head. Malty start, nuts, chocolate, some herbal hints. Also hints of freshly ground coffee. Delicious!

Bottle @ Johns. Pours black with a creamy brown head. Aroma of sweet malt, coffee, caramel, chocolate, light dark fruit. Flavor is light sweet, malt, caramel, littl coffee, chocolate. Medium body, average carbonation, light dry finish. 181016

Bottle, 6.5%. Very dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, caramel and a little liquorice. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, caramel, little liquorice, medium sweet, hop and medium bitter.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting, my place. Nice creamy head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, chocolate, caramel, licorice and hops. Dry finish.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear very dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 181016

On tap@ Beergeek, Prague. Black, large creamy beige head. Aroma anise, malt. Medium body, low carbonation. Taste follows aroma, adds hints of chocolate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Taste on 13.09.16 @ Lauwe.
Black color, with a decent brown creamy head. 
Aroma: chocolate, roasted malts, coffee. Medium body.
Taste: roasted malt, coffee, bit dark fruits, chocolate. 
Not bad.
Beczka. Barwa ciemno brunatna, nie przejrzyste. Piana be?owa, drobna. Aromat palonego s?odu. W smaku goryczka palonego s?odu na poziomie niskim. Piwo, wodniste, nisko nasycone.

Bottle from Base Camp, Prague. Black with a creamy beige head, good lacing. Chocolate aroma, toffee, coffee with milk and toast. Dry, soft and velvety mouthfeel, mildl carbonated. Milk chocolate taste, roasted barley, toffee and white bread. Chalky finish. Well-made!

Lahev s patentním uzávěrem (750ml, diky mockrát za to cestujicí pivo, Michale!): Literally black, big and stable creamy tanned head; moderate to solid dryish - but not completely dry - roasty and also fruity (berries?) nose, a certain bitterness is well detectable, some caramelly traces, too; moderate to solid bitter-sweet flavour, nearly full bodied and soft; dryish bitter-sweet fruity and roasty finish with a nice balancing acidity. As brewed by Mr. Wallenstein himself. Great stuff...

Bottle at home. What a rare treat to encounter a dry stout in the Czech Republic. These dont come around too often. Pours Black with a Tan head. Chocolate, Coffee, charred toast. Full roasty flavour. It ticks all the boxes. Delicious.
Naprosto fantastický stout s krásnými kávovými tóny, výrazně hořký, vysoce pitelný. Takhle to má vypadat .-)

Bottled. Pitch black color with a beige thick soapy head. Fantastic aroma or dark chocolate, pudding, amaretto liqueur. taste mirrors the aroma, balanced, with a dry dark chocolate bitter finish. alcohol hidden. low carbonation but that is ok. overall a jackpot! bravo!
On tap at BeerGeek Bar in Prague. Comes almost black with a decent tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, and malt. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, and a bit of dark fruit. Nice.
Black with no head. Aroma of roast, chocolate, espresso, and more chocolate, very nice. Taste roasty and chocolaty, with some coffee and ash. Very nice
Bottle 0.75l. Black colored. AROMA- dark chocolate, touch of coffee, roasted malts, nuts. FLAVOR- neutral, smooth, pleasantly bitter, dark chocolate, roasted malts. Medium bodied.Really tasty.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2017 #588Many thanks to boys from Albrecht brewery!Bottle 0.75l. Black opaque body, very high tan head. Aroma of chocolate, nuts, toasted malts. Taste is bitter, semi-dry, rich and complex. Nuts, toasted malts, dark chocolate, hint of fruits. Lightly full body, high carbonation. Very good one. Great balanced.
Bottle. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma - Sweet, cocoa, bananamilk, coffee. Taste - Medium sourness, lightly bitter, dark chocolate, coffee.
Black colour, brownish head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts and dark chocolate. Taste is light to medium sweet, light to medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation.
Bottle. Not exactly dry, there is moderate fruity and caramelly body. Black colour, brownish head. Finish is dry and roasty. Overall pleasant level of roastiness. Drinkable
Bottle from 100 piv. Dark brown color with thick beige head. Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate. Taste, coffee, cocoa, dark malt, chocolate, hops. Good.
Bottle at 100piv. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt. Taste is medium sweet, lightly bitter, chocolate, coffee, roasted malt.

Bottle, black hazy color with thick tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, hops, licorice, dried fruits. Taste is roasty, malty, with lot of dark chocolate and long hoppy bitter finish

(tap 0,3l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma: Chocolate.
Appearance: Opaque black. Medium, brown head.
Taste: Chocolate, light roasty, medium sweet, light licorice.
Palate: Medium body. Dry, light warm finish.
Overall: Good, chocolate.
